name: Gorgeous View of Ocean and Golf Course
description:
Enjoy the view through floor to ceiling windows. Share meals and play games in the spacious dining room. Walk 200 steps to the coastal trail. Explore the Monterey Aquarium. You'll be close to restaurants and shops and just a chip shot to the 18th green.

Whether attending one of Monterey Peninsula's many events, celebrating a milestone or anniversary, or simply getting away, our home is the perfect alternative to any hotel.

Try it. We think you'll love i

The space
What makes our space unique is the incredible view out of the living room, kitchen, and front bedroom. The view is the golf course and the ocean, no neighbor's houses. Also the Point Pinos Lighthouse is part of the view. The Lighthouse is the oldest continuously operating lighthouse on the west coast.

Guest access
The whole house is reserved for the guests alone.
neighborhood_overview: A very quiet residential neighborhood in a small town on the Monterey Bay.
host_about: My husband and I️ live in the SF Bay Area. We have two grown sons and five granddaughters. We love to hang out with them. We also play golf and spend time by the ocean.

name: Asilomar Ocean Retreat
description:
Our spacious retreat, on a private half-acre, is a short walk to Asilomar beach. The great room has soaring ceilings, a spacious dining area, a kitchen bar and couches looking onto the gardens. The cozy living room has a wood-burning fireplace. The game room has a foosball table and brochures about area attractions. The lounging spaces and chef’s kitchen will tempt you to hibernate, but our guide also tells about the best walks and restaurants, and fun things to do.
Our license number is 0034

The space
The great room provides a central gathering space for cooking, eating and lounging. The living room provides a more intimate space for watching T.V. or for gathering around the fire. The four bedrooms, with French doors onto the gardens, provide private spaces. The kids can enjoy playing foosball in the game room, shooting hoops in the driveway or exploring the wooded back yard. Dogs are welcome, with prior notice. (There is a $50 pet fee. )
Our retreat
neighborhood_overview: Walk a few blocks to the Asilomar State Park and beach entrance. From there, you may stroll the beach and miles of coastal paths. Asilomar Beach is perfect for tide-pooling and is also the only beach in the area that welcomes dogs. We are walking distance to the beginning of 17-mile drive, one of the most scenic drives in the world and to the Monarch Sanctuary, where thousands of monarch butterflies winter after their migration from Canada.  Downtown Pacific Grove, with its quaint shops and excellent restaurants, is a 6-minute car ride away.   Nearby Lovers Point offers a protected sandy beach, great for kids, swimming, and snorkeling. Directions to all these places are in our guide, which we mail to you before you come. Downtown Carmel is only 15 minutes away. If you want to venture further afield, Big Sur is an hour's drive along the stunning coast road.

description:
Charming private get-away within walking distance to Lover's Point, Asilomar State Beach, Downtown Pacific Grove, Washington Park, Lighthouse, and Monarch Butterfly Sanctuary, and of course the Monterey Bay Aquarium (2 guest passes provided). Cannery Row is just a short hop away. 17 Mile Drive begins a block away towards George Washington Park. Ocean peak view from the upstairs bedroom, and clear view of the Monterey Bay. Live oaks on property providing an enchanted forest feel.
30-day minimum

The space
Beautiful fenced yard, private location, restored 1920s home with modern amenities and plenty of charm.
Gourmet Kitchen, new bathrooms, charm of a corner lot with privacy.

Guest access
Complimentary guest passes (2) to Monterey Bay Aquarium. They're on the dining table near the front door.
Check-in procedure is as simple as showing up, finding the front door [faces Pine, cant miss it!] and entering the provided code on the sm
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighbors, and occasional deer in season. Stand at the intersection of Washington Park and Pine Ave and see the ocean on [3] sides.
host_about:
Long term Californian from the Bay Area , but originally SoCal. Surfing is my favorite hobby feel free to ask me about local spots and even Santa Cruz or spots further still. Getting to know the local mtb spots like Fort Ord and Toro Park [across the road there], also familiar with further spots like Santa Cruz mtns and the spots off Skyline Dr. on the peninsula.

I hope you enjoy your stay and expect that you will have a good time in our spot in Pacific Grove.

name: Pacific Grove Mid Century Near Beach
description:
Mid Century Pacific Grove house on 17 Mile Drive. Just a couple blocks from the Pebble Beach gate. Great area. Close enough to walk to downtown restaurants and shops, Asilomar State Beach and other sites all within minutes of our home. Private yard with a deck and outdoor furniture for entertaining.

Lic. # 0289 - Our City STR Permit restricts us to a maximum of 2 adults per reservation. Any additional guests MUST be under 18 years old.

The space
We thoroughly sanitize all surfaces, knobs, switches and devices in between guests and include disinfectant wipes for your stay.

Our home has a separate master bedroom suite that we occupy. You will have privacy at all times with your own front door entrance.

Guest access
Guest access is via their own front door off a very small cul-de-sac street. Guests will have their own code to access the Schlage security lock on their unit. No keys necessary.

Other
neighborhood_overview:
We are a lovely 10 minute stroll from many restaurants, shops and Asilomar Beach – – one of the most beautiful beaches on the Monterey Peninsula


Our home is just a minute away the Pacific Grove gate of Pebble Beach and the Spanish Bay resort.

name: Forest Haven in Pebble Beach
description:
Located in the gated golf community of Pebble Beach, Forest Haven is within walking distance of Spanish Bay resort and the Pacific Ocean. Enjoy the Spanish Bay bagpiper while you sip wine at sunset, or, just kick-back and enjoy the comfort and beauty of Forest Haven.

The space
Two hours south of San Francisco, on the Monterey Peninsula, you will find Forest Haven. Home to a family, the house is warm, friendly, and welcoming. Share wine and conversation before one of the two fireplaces. Or, enjoy your dinner on the patio among towering pines and graceful oaks. You’ll hear waves crashing on the beach as you soak in the last rays of the sun.

The master bedroom, decorated in soft blues, whites, and cream colors features a new king size bed with reading lamps and bathroom with shower. The two other bedrooms share a recently remodeled tiled bath with tub / shower. The patio bedroom features an antique full size white iron bed. The front bedroom features two
neighborhood_overview:
Forest Haven is less than a mile from the Country Club Gate to Pebble Beach. Just outside the gate a shopping center provides grocery store, pharmacy, restaurants (Starbucks!), and shops. The neighborhood of well-maintained single family houses is quiet and serene. Residents walk their dogs and children bike to school.

The charming town of Pacific Grove is where those bicycling children attend school. Billing itself as “America’s Last Hometown,” this Victorian-era seaside resort, founded by Methodists in the late 19th century, is reminiscent of a New England coastal town. Grey clapboard houses are graced by old gardens. Many tourists never make their way to PG, as residents know it...all the better for you!
host_about: I'm a California native who is also an Airbnb host. I live in Pebble Beach and work in Palo Alto. I have three children so my spare time is spent hanging out with them and enjoying our gorgeous area!

name: Pacific Grove Willis House, Walk to Town and Beach
description:
Experience the Monterey Peninsula like a local in the owner-hosted and newly remodeled Willis House in the heart of Pacific Grove. Downtown PG is a short stroll and Lovers Point Beach & Park is just beyond that. A little farther afield are Asilomar State Beach, the Monterey Bay Aquarium, and the towns of Monterey, Pebble Beach, and Carmel. Day-trippers can enjoy the Big Sur coast, year-round whale watching, and Point Lobos State Natural Reserve. (NOTE: Children ages 10+ welcome.)

The space
Built by William Willis in 1904, this historical home has been remodeled from floor to ceiling. You'll find inviting human-scaled rooms, wood furniture, and bright common areas with plenty of windows. The kitchen has a commercial-style gas range, quality cutlery, ample cooking equipment, modern appliances, engineered stone countertops, and a separate dining area. The bedrooms at the rear of the house, away from the street, are quiet and have blackout curtains and comfortable fu
neighborhood_overview:
Pacific Grove is situated centrally on the Monterey Peninsula between the towns of Monterey and Pebble Beach. Our neighborhood is residential, quiet, and filled with well-maintained older houses and cottages of vernacular architectural styles, particularly Victorian, Craftsman, Stick, and Shotgun.

An easy four-block walk takes you to downtown's restaurants, coffee shops, bakeries, banks, shops, art studios, and churches. You'll also find a grocery store, hardware store, pharmacy, library, natural history museum, and post office.

From downtown, a short stroll takes you to Lovers Point Beach & Park, where you can relax on the grass or sand, or rent bikes, kayaks, standup paddleboards, or family surreys from Adventures By The Sea. Surfers and divers will find outfitters in Monterey.

In Pacific Grove's Forest Hill business district (distinct from downtown and a one-mile drive from the house), you'll find larger stores and chains such as Safeway, Trader Joe'
host_about: I'm Chris. I host a single home with undivided attention and never use property managers or co-hosts. I've lived in Pacific Grove for almost 20 years and I'm happy to answer questions about the house, town, and area. During your stay, you can reach me by email, text message, phone, or in person. I work in the detached cottage next door but the extent of our interaction is up to you. I enjoy meeting people and hearing their stories but also appreciate their need for privacy. Should we pass each other during the course of your stay, feel free to ask a question, chat, or just wave hello. I'm fully vaccinated for Covid-19.

name: 3743 Nightly Rental ~ Walk to the Aquarium, the Be
description:
1039 sf, 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom vacation home sleeps up to 4 guests. 1 King, 1 Queen. Dog OK. No garage.

Welcome to Pelican Peaks! Sleeps 4 adults

With beautiful ocean views and the beach just steps from the front door, this Pacific Grove home is truly a bay lover’s dream come true.

The 2-bedroom, 2-bath cottage is a few minutes'’ walk from the Monterey Bay Recreation Trail and Andy Jacobson Park, and is within easy walking distance of the Monterey Bay Aquarium and Cannery Row as well as ...

The space
...a variety of restaurants on Pacific Grove’s Central Avenue. Downtown Pacific Grove is just a 5-minute car ride away, and 15 minutes' to either charming Carmel-by-the-Sea or golfing and dining in Pebble Beach®.

The flower-covered home, originally built in 1925, has been enlarged and updated to create light-filled rooms that mix colorful vintage and contemporary furnishings. Hardwood bamboo floors throughout the main level
neighborhood_overview:
Please download our App to obtain our local recommendations and area attractions. Access to the App is automatically provided via email after your reservation is paid in full. You can share this app with all the guests in your party.
Please note that our Good Neighbor Policy is posted in our home and is strictly enforced.
host_about:
Sanctuary Vacation Rentals represents properties throughout Carmel, Pebble Beach, Pacific Grove, Carmel Highlands, and the Big Sur coastline. We combine fine resort accommodations and relaxed elegance with all the comforts of home. 
Our properties are places that nurture and inspire and are located in one of the most beautiful, energizing places in the world, featuring the spectacular scenery of the Monterey Peninsula and the central coast of California.  From historic old Monterey, to the Victorian charm of Pacific Grove, and the artists colony of Carmel-by-the-Sea, and the breathtaking scenery of Big Sur, generations of people have been rejuvenated by the breaking waves and sandy beaches here.
Our properties are designer furnished with relaxed elegance.  Many homes feature the colors of the sea and take inspiration from the natural beauty of the surrounding areas.
Throughout Sanctuary’s vacation rentals, you’ll find comfortable beds with luxury linens, welcome beverages and hors d’oeuvres, spa robes and amenities, local wine tasting and spa passes, and a personal concierge to assist you in every way.  Our homes feature chef’s dream kitchens and everything you’ll need to entertain in style.  And many of our properties are pet friendly.
If you’re looking for a refreshing, relaxed stay in one of the most beautiful areas in the world– offering all the comforts of home, let Sanctuary Vacation Rentals help you discover your own sanctuary by the sea.  

The Monterey Peninsula is unique in its combination of breathtaking natural resources and a multiplicity of cultural and entertainment possibilities. You can find something for every possible taste. For nature lovers, there is the diversity of mountain and sea, for picnicking, surfing, fishing, horseback riding, hiking, beach-combing, bird-watching, kayaking, scuba diving, tide-pooling, biking and more. If you want a man-made excitement, we have art galleries galore, excellent fine-art museums, local theatre, outstanding restaurants, boutiques, a natural history and a children's museum, a world-class aquarium, and that's just for starters. History buffs will have a field day exploring the adobes of Monterey. There's so much to do that you cannot possibly do it all in one visit, which means you will have to come back.

host_about:
Sanctuary Vacation Rentals represents properties throughout Carmel, Pebble Beach, Pacific Grove, Carmel Highlands, and the Big Sur coastline. We combine fine resort accommodations and relaxed elegance with all the comforts of home. 
Our properties are places that nurture and inspire and are located in one of the most beautiful, energizing places in the world, featuring the spectacular scenery of the Monterey Peninsula and the central coast of California.  From historic old Monterey, to the Victorian charm of Pacific Grove, and the artists colony of Carmel-by-the-Sea, and the breathtaking scenery of Big Sur, generations of people have been rejuvenated by the breaking waves and sandy beaches here.
Our properties are designer furnished with relaxed elegance.  Many homes feature the colors of the sea and take inspiration from the natural beauty of the surrounding areas.
Throughout Sanctuary’s vacation rentals, you’ll find comfortable beds with luxury linens, welcome beverages and hors d’oeuvres, spa robes and amenities, local wine tasting and spa passes, and a personal concierge to assist you in every way.  Our homes feature chef’s dream kitchens and everything you’ll need to entertain in style.  And many of our properties are pet friendly.
If you’re looking for a refreshing, relaxed stay in one of the most beautiful areas in the world– offering all the comforts of home, let Sanctuary Vacation Rentals help you discover your own sanctuary by the sea.  

The Monterey Peninsula is unique in its combination of breathtaking natural resources and a multiplicity of cultural and entertainment possibilities. You can find something for every possible taste. For nature lovers, there is the diversity of mountain and sea, for picnicking, surfing, fishing, horseback riding, hiking, beach-combing, bird-watching, kayaking, scuba diving, tide-pooling, biking and more. If you want a man-made excitement, we have art galleries galore, excellent fine-art museums, local theatre, outstanding restaurants, boutiques, a natural history and a children's museum, a world-class aquarium, and that's just for starters. History buffs will have a field day exploring the adobes of Monterey. There's so much to do that you cannot possibly do it all in one visit, which means you will have to come back.

From historic old Monterey, to the Victorian charm of Pacific Grove, and the artists colony of Carmel-by-the-Sea, and the breathtaking scenery of Big Sur, generations of people have been rejuvenated by the breaking waves and sandy beaches here.
Our properties are designer furnished with relaxed elegance.  Many homes feature the colors of the sea and take inspiration from the natural beauty of the surrounding areas.
Throughout Sanctuary’s vacation rentals, you’ll find comfortable beds with luxury linens, welcome beverages and hors d’oeuvres, spa robes and amenities, local wine tasting and spa passes, and a personal concierge to assist you in every way.  Our homes feature chef’s dream kitchens and everything you’ll need to entertain in style.  And many of our properties are pet friendly.
If you’re looking for a refreshing, relaxed stay in one of the most beautiful areas in the world– offering all the comforts of home, let Sanctuary Vacation Rentals help you discover your own sanctuary by the sea.  

The Monterey Peninsula is unique in its combination of breathtaking natural resources and a multiplicity of cultural and entertainment possibilities. You can find something for every possible taste. For nature lovers, there is the diversity of mountain and sea, for picnicking, surfing, fishing, horseback riding, hiking, beach-combing, bird-watching, kayaking, scuba diving, tide-pooling, biking and more. If you want a man-made excitement, we have art galleries galore, excellent fine-art museums, local theatre, outstanding restaurants, boutiques, a natural history and a children's museum, a world-class aquarium, and that's just for starters. History buffs will have a field day exploring the adobes of Monterey. There's so much to do that you cannot possibly do it all in one visit, which means you will have to come back.

name: 3573 Nightly Rental ~ Stunning Ocean Views! Histor
description:
2356 sf, 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom vacation home sleeps up to 6 guests. 3 kings. Dog OK. No garage.

Welcome to "Captain's Castle"! Sleeps up to 8 adults.

This historic home built in 1883, sits just steps from Monterey Bay and a walking/bicycling trail that meanders for 15 miles along the coastline. You're less than a 10 minute walk along this trail to Cannery Row and the aquarium.

The exterior of this whimsical 2356 square feet, 3-bedroom, 2-bath home, called "Captain's Castle," comes ...

The space
...complete with gargoyles, gables and stained glass windows. The predominant feature is a square tower that offers a bird's-eye view of all the comings and goings on the bay.

As you open the front door to the entry, with its coved ceiling and built-in cabinetry with insets of royal blue, topaz and wine that match the stained-glass panels framing virtually every window in the house, you will feel you are in your own seaside inn.

name: Upstairs Studio in Pacific Grove
description:
Cozy studio located in Pacific Grove. The perfect place to stay while you enjoy the Concours d'Elegance, the AT&T Pro Am golf tournament, or any of the other special events in the area. Great location with easy access to downtown PG (8 minute walk), Lover's Point Beach, Monterey Bay Aquarium (15 min walk), and some of the best dining and family friendly activities that PG has to offer. Easy access to Asilomar, 17 mile drive, Carmel by the Sea, Carmel, Pebble Beach, Point Lobos, and Big Sur!

The space
This is a fantastic studio perfect for your getaway. Very clean, with full kitchen, bathroom, and queen size bed. The studio is private and quiet with peek a boo views of the bay! Enjoy the backyard, BBQ grill, and patio set. There is an outdoor shower with hot water for your use after a day at the beach.

Guest access
Private entry with complete use of studio. Guests will also have use of laundry room.
We offer off-street parking for The
neighborhood_overview:
Pacific Grove is a coastal city known for its Victorian homes, Asilomar Beach, and its coastal migration of Monarch butterflies (Butterfly Town, USA). The city is also home to the oldest continuously working lighthouse on the West Coast, Point Pinos. The Pacific Grove Natural History Museum, located in downtown PG, is a living field guide to the Central Coast, showcasing native flora and fauna.
The Monterey Bay Coastal Recreation Trail offers breathtaking views of the Pacific Ocean and is a wonderful way to tour PG, Monterey, and surrounding areas, while enjoying the outdoors.
host_about: We live, work and raise our son on the Monterey Peninsula.  We love to share our little slice of paradise with guests and fellow travelers.

Our properties are places that nurture and inspire and are located in one of the most beautiful, energizing places in the world, featuring the spectacular scenery of the Monterey Peninsula and the central coast of California.  From historic old Monterey, to the Victorian charm of Pacific Grove, and the artists colony of Carmel-by-the-Sea, and the breathtaking scenery of Big Sur, generations of people have been rejuvenated by the breaking waves and sandy beaches here.
Our properties are designer furnished with relaxed elegance.  Many homes feature the colors of the sea and take inspiration from the natural beauty of the surrounding areas.
Throughout Sanctuary’s vacation rentals, you’ll find comfortable beds with luxury linens, welcome beverages and hors d’oeuvres, spa robes and amenities, local wine tasting and spa passes, and a personal concierge to assist you in every way.  Our homes feature chef’s dream kitchens and everything you’ll need to entertain in style.  And many of our properties are pet friendly.
If you’re looking for a refreshing, relaxed stay in one of the most beautiful areas in the world– offering all the comforts of home, let Sanctuary Vacation Rentals help you discover your own sanctuary by the sea.  

The Monterey Peninsula is unique in its combination of breathtaking natural resources and a multiplicity of cultural and entertainment possibilities. You can find something for every possible taste. For nature lovers, there is the diversity of mountain and sea, for picnicking, surfing, fishing, horseback riding, hiking, beach-combing, bird-watching, kayaking, scuba diving, tide-pooling, biking and more. If you want a man-made excitement, we have art galleries galore, excellent fine-art museums, local theatre, outstanding restaurants, boutiques, a natural history and a children's museum, a world-class aquarium, and that's just for starters. History buffs will have a field day exploring the adobes of Monterey. There's so much to do that you cannot possibly do it all in one visit, which means you will have to come back.

name: Entire Flat, quiet, upstairs , 2 blocks from ocean
description:
30 Day Minimum due to local restrictions. Amazing views of Monterey Bay, quiet and private one bedroom upstairs apartment with full kitchen and bathroom with a shower, toilet and sink. ABSOLUTELY NO ANIMALS DUE TO ALLERGIES OF FAMILY MEMBER.

The space
Guests are only allowed to use the upstairs unit.

Guest access
The entire apartment is private and is yours to enjoy during your stay.

Other things to note
Block away from the ocean and in a very lovely neighborhood.
garbage is picked up on Tuesday mornings. Cans are in the driveway. Please make sure trash can has bunny cord securing the lid, we have raccoons in Pacific Grove.
Your gate needs to be locked at all times, when you enter and when you leave. Bikes and other things have been stolen if gate is not locked.
neighborhood_overview: Block away from Oceanside bike path, 10 minute walk to downtown Pacific Grove with shops, restaurants and more. 10 minute walk to Lover's Point Beach. We have security cameras around the house with motion sensors.  The upstairs porch light is on 24/7. Please do not turn light off.  I am always available by phone or text.  If you notice any issues please do not hesitate to text me.  If you notice leaks, drips or other issues that need to be brought to my attention, please do not delay, I will promptly attend to all issues.
host_about: Active lifestyle, to bed early, up early, trying to garden, bake and keep the house.

name: Cloud Forest Retreat
description: We offer a private room with private bath in a family home in Pebble Beach. Keypad entry check-in. The hosts are fully vaccinated and boosted, and live on premise. We have a friendly indoor cat, so if you are allergic to cats, this is probably not a good fit for you. If you are a cat lover, you will find a friendly feline. Please be aware that we have two guest rooms, so there may be other guests in the house.

All space including front and fully fenced private backyard

name: Sunset Inn Pacific Grove
description:
Cozy and secluded Bed and Breakfast Inn, just a 5 minute walk to famous Asilomar State Beach and Pacific Grove Municipal Golf Course. Rate includes Continental Breakfast in hotel lobby with free outdoor parking. Just minutes drive from Cannery Row and downtown Monterey/Fisherman's Wharf. Rooms are elegantly designed, many with fireplaces.

The space
Romantic getaway

Other things to note
Rate includes daily Continental Breakfast, served in the lobby.
neighborhood_overview: Secluded atmosphere, woody and refreshing, just a few minutes walk from Asilomar State Beach.
host_about: My name is Rishi Patel, I am the owner of the Sunset Inn Pacific Grove.  If you need anything, please email me or the front (Email hidden by Airbnb) or call (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) We look forward to hosting you soon!

name: Pacific Suite (PG License # 0420)
description:
Welcome to Pacific Suite. Located on Lighthouse Ave. in Pacific Grove. Two blocks from the ocean. Suite offers a slight ocean view with hardwood floors, spacious living room, gas fireplace, kitchen, 2 balconies, one large bedroom with a queen size bed, a full bathroom, and flat screen cable TV. The kitchen has electric stove/oven, microwave, refrigerator, and Keurig coffee maker. There is a pull out double bed in the living room.

The space
One Bedroom, bathroom, kitchen, dining room, living room, and 2 balconies. Partial Ocean view. Located above Petra Restaurant. Very short walk to the ocean. Centrally located.

Guest access
Guest have private access to the entire apartment suite as well as the entrance hallway.

Other things to note
-There is a 12% local tax that will be charged to the reservation.

-Maximum 2 guests .

-Petra Restaurant is below the apartment suite. They are open Monday thru
neighborhood_overview: Welcome to America’s last hometown. Downtown Pacific Grove 2 blocks from Ocean. Walk to ocean, restaurants, movie theater, Lover’s Point, and downtown. Very Short drive to Carmel, Pebble Beach, Monterey, Cannery Row, Fisherman’s Wharf, and Aquarium. Pacific Grove is a very safe City.

name: Fairlawn Room - Seven Gables Inn
description:
The Fairlawn Room is attached to the front side of the Main House on the northwest corner, a few steps above the front garden. With soft colors of creams and tans, it features a lovely ocean view with a private outside entrance from the garden pathway.

• Rooms are sanitized following the Clean+Safe protocol outlined by Calif Lodging Assoc. Due to COVID-19 there is NO interim maid service.
• Complimentary breakfast.
• Lots of restaurants very close to Inn.

The space
*Beautifully furnished with modern amenities.
*NO TV
*Complimentary breakfast
*Free WiFi
*Free On-street parking

Guest access
Full access to room 24 hours a day.

Pacific Grove and Monterey are right next to each other.  Carmel is just a short 5 mile drive away.
host_about:
As of June 23rd 2021, The Seven Gables Inn is managed by the Kirkwood Collection. 

Our Inn welcomed its first guests in 1982 and since then, we have enjoyed every aspect of Innkeeping. 

For all reservation questions please feel free to send us a message as we will respond as soon as possible. 

We boast a total 25 individually decorated guest rooms, each with their own private bathroom and many with private outside entrances that only you would use. 

Every one of our lovely rooms have views of the Monterey Bay and the beautiful Monterey Peninsula coastline. 

Each room has a Keurig beverage maker.

We gladly anticipate the wishes of our guests and endeavor to make your visit to Seven Gables Inn one that you will always remember. 

—Your hosts, The Kirkwood Collection and Staff

neighborhood_overview:
Please download our App to obtain our local recommendations and area attractions. Access to the App is automatically provided via email after your reservation is paid in full. You can share this app with all the guests in your party.
Please note that our Good Neighbor Policy is posted in our home and is strictly enforced.
host_about:
Sanctuary Vacation Rentals represents properties throughout Carmel, Pebble Beach, Pacific Grove, Carmel Highlands, and the Big Sur coastline. We combine fine resort accommodations and relaxed elegance with all the comforts of home. 
Our properties are places that nurture and inspire and are located in one of the most beautiful, energizing places in the world, featuring the spectacular scenery of the Monterey Peninsula and the central coast of California.  From historic old Monterey, to the Victorian charm of Pacific Grove, and the artists colony of Carmel-by-the-Sea, and the breathtaking scenery of Big Sur, generations of people have been rejuvenated by the breaking waves and sandy beaches here.
Our properties are designer furnished with relaxed elegance.  Many homes feature the colors of the sea and take inspiration from the natural beauty of the surrounding areas.
Throughout Sanctuary’s vacation rentals, you’ll find comfortable beds with luxury linens, welcome beverages and hors d’oeuvres, spa robes and amenities, local wine tasting and spa passes, and a personal concierge to assist you in every way.  Our homes feature chef’s dream kitchens and everything you’ll need to entertain in style.  And many of our properties are pet friendly.
If you’re looking for a refreshing, relaxed stay in one of the most beautiful areas in the world– offering all the comforts of home, let Sanctuary Vacation Rentals help you discover your own sanctuary by the sea.  

The Monterey Peninsula is unique in its combination of breathtaking natural resources and a multiplicity of cultural and entertainment possibilities. You can find something for every possible taste. For nature lovers, there is the diversity of mountain and sea, for picnicking, surfing, fishing, horseback riding, hiking, beach-combing, bird-watching, kayaking, scuba diving, tide-pooling, biking and more. If you want a man-made excitement, we have art galleries galore, excellent fine-art museums, local theatre, outstanding restaurants, boutiques, a natural history and a children's museum, a world-class aquarium, and that's just for starters. History buffs will have a field day exploring the adobes of Monterey. There's so much to do that you cannot possibly do it all in one visit, which means you will have to come back.

name: Manyas House  30 night minimum
description:
Welcome to Manya's House in Monterey, California!

Manya’s House is bright, quiet, and peaceful and located in a neighborhood that shares those qualities. This spacious, three bedroom home was completely remodeled and refurbished in 2015 to include a beautiful, upscale kitchen with Stainless Steel appliances.

This beautiful home is conveniently located in Monterey’s Upper Old Town. Visitors find themselves within minutes of Monterey’s Fishermans Wharf, Cannery Row and the Monterey Bay Aquarium. Monterey’s downtown, Alvarado Street, the prestigious Middlebury Institute of International Studies at Monterey, Naval Postgraduate School, Defense Language Institute and historic Presidio of Monterey are all within walking distance.

Manya’s House features an open, airy floor plan. New hardwood floors host a large living area adjoining the dining area. An elegantly upholstered sectional unit provides seating for the guests to gather and converse or w
neighborhood_overview:
The Monterey Peninsula is different than any other part of California. Here, time slows, the architecture is humble (with the exception of the homes in Pebble Beach), and the lifestyle is the perfect synthesis of SoCal laid back and NorCal sophisticated. On the northern side of the peninsula, the town of Monterey draws most of the tourists, while farther south, Carmel-by-the-Sea lures the easygoing wealthy set. Tremendous price tags on real estate helps maintain the small-community atmosphere along Monterey's jaw-dropping coastline.

This area makes for a tremendous road-trip stop or romantic weekend stay. And did we mention the golf courses? This stretch of the California coastline boasts some of the most coveted fairways in the world. Add to than an abundance of natural wonders, luxury resorts and seafood restaurants, and Monterey might just be the ideal destination for your next getaway.
host_about:
Our CEO, MaryJane was an executive with the Hyatt for seven years. She chose to leave the work force and stayed home to raise three boys! MaryJane fell into a job I loved, managing a Vacation Rental Company on the Monterey Peninsula and fell in LOVE with the idea of renting homes instead of Hotels. She left the company and started her own business to continue her passion for meeting people near and far and sharing the love of travel.

AirBnb had software problems, and had to recreate several of our listings,  under a second account.

You may see MaryJane's 149 Guest Reviews from the original Host Account.

name: Mermaid Crossing
description:
"Entire Home including Guest House" hosted by Rhonda. Mermaid Crossing offers two houses for the price of one! The main house offers two bedrooms, and the detached guest house offers a full bath and a king size bed. Ocean views from every room! Serene and private setting.

The space
"Entire Home including Guest House" hosted by Rhonda. Mermaid Crossing offers two houses for the price of one! The main house offers two bedrooms with queen size beds in each room, and the detached guest house offers a full bath and a king size bed. Ocean views from every room! Serene and private setting. Flexible living arrangements with 2/1.5 house & 1/1 cottage. Gourmet Kitchen. Big Patio, BBQ & Firepit.
 “Mermaid Crossing” is the perfect location to experience all that Monterey, California has to offer.  Mermaid Crossing was a labor of love, as the owners painstakingly updated and restored this 100 year-old historic beach cottage to be enjoyed for generations to come. Keep y
neighborhood_overview:
“Mermaid Crossing” is located on Mermaid Ave. the premier destination for those who want easy (walking or biking) access to all the conveniences and attractions but would rather enjoy the quiet serenity this zone provides. At Mermaid Crossing, you can park the car and forget about it. Walk out the front door and take 70 steps until your toes touch the water at famous Lover’s Point, a calm swimming beach during the summer that boasts great surfing during the winter months. Take in the jaw-dropping views of the entire Monterey Bay as you stroll along the Monterey Recreation trail to the front doors of the world renowned Monterey Bay Aquarium.
Great dining options abound the closest being the historic Beach House at Lover’s Point which has a full bar (open late) and gourmet seafood. Bringing your clubs? The Pacific Grove Municipal Golf Links is quite literally, in your backyard. Enjoy it’s stellar reputation as one of the “Nation’s Top 50 Gold Courses under $50.00” by Golf Digest.
host_about:
Rhonda is the managing broker of Pacific Grove Property Management. Their goal is to make your stay with them pleasurable enough to leave you longing to come back! They love where they live and can't wait to share it with you!

neighborhood_overview:
The Monterey Peninsula is world-renown for its beauty! Enjoy the Monterey Aquarium, Fisherman’s Wharf and historic Cannery Row. Great golf, fine dining and plenty to see and do. Whatever your pleasure the Monterey Peninsula is the perfect vacation destination, and Pacific Grove is in the heart of it all.

Sharing borders with the City of Monterey, the Pacific Ocean, and the Del Monte Forest, Pacific Grove offers breathtaking views and recreational activities. The City provides services to the community including: excellent fire, emergency, and ocean rescue services; an award-winning natural history museum; the lowest crime rate of any city in Monterey County; a nationally-recognized 18-hole golf course; a monarch butterfly habitat sanctuary; sandy beaches; and, the oldest continuously-operating lighthouse on the west coast. "P.G." is known for its small-town hospitality and friendliness, so come experience it yourself!

As of June 23rd 2021, The Seven Gables Inn is managed by the Kirkwood Collection. 

Our Inn welcomed its first guests in 1982 and since then, we have enjoyed every aspect of Innkeeping. 

For all reservation questions please feel free to send us a message as we will respond as soon as possible. 

We boast a total 25 individually decorated guest rooms, each with their own private bathroom and many with private outside entrances that only you would use. 

Every one of our lovely rooms have views of the Monterey Bay and the beautiful Monterey Peninsula coastline. 

Each room has a Keurig beverage maker.

We gladly anticipate the wishes of our guests and endeavor to make your visit to Seven Gables Inn one that you will always remember. 

—Your hosts, The Kirkwood Collection and Staff

name: Sallie’s Cottage
description: Wake up feeling inspired by the cheerful interior of this colorful home. The historic residence features beamed cathedral ceilings, eclectic furnishings and decor, contrasting textures and patterns throughout, a private yard, and a deck for dining.
neighborhood_overview: The house is very close to downtown and the beach, an easy walk in either direction. The neighborhood is full of quaint historic buildings, shops, and restaurants. There is plenty of on street, also off-street parking for one car in the driveway.
host_about:
I'm an architect, with with a background in design, land planning and historic preservation. I have a passion for nature, family, dogs, horses, travel and adventures.

My husband Tom is an ecologist, coastal biologist and park planner. Obviously, he is also a lover of nature!

Together Tom and I have painstakingly restored two historic houses in Pacific Grove... Including our 120 year old Airbnb cottage, which we started more than 30 years ago.

We've traveled the world together and separately, drawn to near and distant locations by friends,  culture, waves, and whimsy.

Airbnb hosting has allowed me to share the cottage that I love with people who enjoying it as I do. It is a genuine pleasure meeting the terrific people who visit on their adventures!

name: Ocean Front Pacific Grove Cottage
description:
Although very simple the architectural design takes in the view completely. It feels like you are sailing or flying over the water from the large picture windows. The living room has a hide-a-bed and a Futon and even a loft bed so you don't lose a second of looking out the windows. The Master suite is like a rustic cabin with hints of elegance and a very comfortable queen bed. the kitchen has all the modern conveniences. We have had guests from around the world stay with us.

The space
Gas range and oven, Refrigerator, dishwasher and washer and dryer are great time-savers. There is a dinner service for 12 and large families have been known to have their Thanksgiving dinner in the cabin. Cayaks, boat rentals and surrey rentals are all close by. The aquarium is just over a mile away and the Natural History Museum is only 1/2 mile away. name: Tumtum Tree Cottage - Jabberwock Inn
description:
Our newest addition - the Tumtum Tree is a quaint Craftsman styled cottage nestled amongst a grove of Monterey Cypress and a giant redwood. Nearly surrounded by a redwood deck, the cottage boasts magnificent views of the Monterey Bay and our gardens. With separate sleeping room and living room, it can easily accommodate a family of four by using a surprisingly comfortable sofa sleeper.

The space
WELCOME TO JABBERWOCK INN of Monterey, California. Set on a half-acre of fanciful gardens, this 1911 Craftsman-style bed and breakfast inn provides fabulous views of the Monterey Bay with its famous sea otters and seals. In the late afternoon, wine and hors d'oeuvres are served on the enclosed sun porch and after dinner, guests are treated to homemade cookies and milk. When you're ready to settle in for the evening, you'll find cozy beds complete with comfy sheets and comforters. Sleep soundly, knowing that a scrumptious breakfast awaits you.

Guest access
neighborhood_overview: The Jabberwock is only five short blocks above Cannery Row (made famous by author John Steinbeck). Visit Doc Rickett's Lab on Cannery Row, the Monterey Bay Aquarium, Carmel -by-the-Sea, Pebble Beach, Old Fisherman's Wharf and Point Lobos/Big Sur from our Monterey Bed & Breakfast.  The Monterey/Pacific Grove recreation trail, just four blocks down the hill, offers an extraordinary walking, jogging, and biking path. Perhaps you will want to explore the tide pools of Asilomar beach or play at Window on the Bay park, in any case, as you meander the trail, enjoy the scenic Monterey bay views and the historic architecture of Monterey; California's first capital.
host_about: Our Monterey Bed and Breakfast Inn was named after the Lewis Carroll poem Jabberwocky ...from his famous book, "Through the Looking Glass." The ambiance of our seven room inn is light-hearted, warmly comfortable, and decidedly upscale.  We enjoy meeting and caring for our guests who come from near and far. Some come for romance, others for a quick adventure getaway, and many for one of the Monterey peninsula's numerous events. Families and friends come as a group for enchanted reunions ... many return often to re-experience the beautiful blend of elegance and innocence that is woven into every aspect of Jabberwock Inn!  We hope you will as well.

The space
WELCOME TO JABBERWOCK INN of Monterey, California. Set on a half-acre of fanciful gardens, this 1911 Craftsman-style bed and breakfast inn provides fabulous views of the Monterey Bay with its famous sea otters and seals. In the late afternoon, wine and hors d'oeuvres are served on the enclosed sun porch and after dinner, guests are treated to homemade cookies and milk. When you're ready to settle in for the evening, you'll find cozy beds complete with comfy sheets and comforters. Three rooms include Jacuzzi tubs for two and fireplaces. Sleep soundly, knowing that a scrumptious breakfast awaits you.

neighborhood_overview: The Jabberwock is only five short blocks above Cannery Row (made famous by author John Steinbeck). Visit Doc Rickett's Lab on Cannery Row, the Monterey Bay Aquarium, Carmel -by-the-Sea, Pebble Beach, Old Fisherman's Wharf and Point Lobos/Big Sur from our Monterey Bed & Breakfast.  The Monterey/Pacific Grove recreation trail, just four blocks down the hill, offers an extraordinary walking, jogging, and biking path. Perhaps you will want to explore the tide pools of Asilomar beach or play at Window on the Bay park, in any case, as you meander the trail, enjoy the scenic Monterey bay views and the historic architecture of Monterey; California's first capital.
host_about: Our Monterey Bed and Breakfast Inn was named after the Lewis Carroll poem Jabberwocky ...from his famous book, "Through the Looking Glass." The ambiance of our seven room inn is light-hearted, warmly comfortable, and decidedly upscale.  We enjoy meeting and caring for our guests who come from near and far. Some come for romance, others for a quick adventure getaway, and many for one of the Monterey peninsula's numerous events. Families and friends come as a group for enchanted reunions ... many return often to re-experience the beautiful blend of elegance and innocence that is woven into every aspect of Jabberwock Inn!  We hope you will as well.

host_about:
Sanctuary Vacation Rentals represents properties throughout Carmel, Pebble Beach, Pacific Grove, Carmel Highlands, and the Big Sur coastline. We combine fine resort accommodations and relaxed elegance with all the comforts of home. 
Our properties are places that nurture and inspire and are located in one of the most beautiful, energizing places in the world, featuring the spectacular scenery of the Monterey Peninsula and the central coast of California.  From historic old Monterey, to the Victorian charm of Pacific Grove, and the artists colony of Carmel-by-the-Sea, and the breathtaking scenery of Big Sur, generations of people have been rejuvenated by the breaking waves and sandy beaches here.
Our properties are designer furnished with relaxed elegance.  Many homes feature the colors of the sea and take inspiration from the natural beauty of the surrounding areas.
Throughout Sanctuary’s vacation rentals, you’ll find comfortable beds with luxury linens, welcome beverages and hors d’oeuvres, spa robes and amenities, local wine tasting and spa passes, and a personal concierge to assist you in every way.  Our homes feature chef’s dream kitchens and everything you’ll need to entertain in style.  And many of our properties are pet friendly.
If you’re looking for a refreshing, relaxed stay in one of the most beautiful areas in the world– offering all the comforts of home, let Sanctuary Vacation Rentals help you discover your own sanctuary by the sea.  

The Monterey Peninsula is unique in its combination of breathtaking natural resources and a multiplicity of cultural and entertainment possibilities. You can find something for every possible taste. For nature lovers, there is the diversity of mountain and sea, for picnicking, surfing, fishing, horseback riding, hiking, beach-combing, bird-watching, kayaking, scuba diving, tide-pooling, biking and more. If you want a man-made excitement, we have art galleries galore, excellent fine-art museums, local theatre, outstanding restaurants, boutiques, a natural history and a children's museum, a world-class aquarium, and that's just for starters. History buffs will have a field day exploring the adobes of Monterey. There's so much to do that you cannot possibly do it all in one visit, which means you will have to come back.

name: Miller Suite: Mid Century Modern in the Forest
description:
The Miller Suite was built and finished to complement the 1965 mid-century modern main home that we occupy full time. We share a walkway from the driveway and we access the same outdoor garbage cans, but we share no other circulation.

This 1-bedroom, 1-bath, private entry suite is perfect for your next road trip, weekend away, proposal, babymoon, anniversary, or even a romantic place for your quiet elopement. Nestled in the oaks behind a privacy fence, the entire property feels secluded.

The space
Weather on the Monterey Peninsula is temperate, averaging in the low 60s. If it gets warmer, the Dutch door and windows create a comfortable breeze. Any cooler, and the new high-efficiency heater will warm you right up. It's a cozy space, most comfortable for a single, a couple, or a couple with a small child (there's an ottoman that folds out into a single bed). A refrigerator will keep your local wines cool, and hold your other refreshments as well.
neighborhood_overview: Most folks don't realize that Pebble Beach is situated in the Del Monte Forest.  There are 8 golf courses inside the gates (Pebble Beach Company courses are the Links at Pebble Beach, Spanish Bay, and Spyglass (Peter Hay par 3 is currently closed).  The NCGA home course is Poppy Hills.  Cypress Point is privately owned by the members, and on most golfers' bucket lists.  If you know a member at the Monterey Peninsula Country Club, either their Dunes or Shores course will spoil you).  There are miles and miles of hiking and equestrian trails.  It's a one-mile walk or drive to the Inn at Spanish Bay, where you can catch the boardwalk and walk the coast, or stay for drinks, a bagpiper performance at sunset, or a wonderful dinner.  Wildlife abounds; deer are frequently spotted on the courses and on the roads. (Keep your eyes open at dusk - they are hard to spot on the sides of the road and frequently roam in pairs!)
host_about: I own and operate a food tour business in Carmel, CA.  Happily married with two grown children, two fur babies.  Pickleballer, spin instructor, and CrossFitter. Introvert. Favorite book is Art of Racing in the Rain by Garth Stein.  Greatest weakness: lack of patience.  Sarcasm is my native language.

host_about:
As of June 23rd 2021, The Seven Gables Inn is managed by the Kirkwood Collection. 

Our Inn welcomed its first guests in 1982 and since then, we have enjoyed every aspect of Innkeeping. 

For all reservation questions please feel free to send us a message as we will respond as soon as possible. 

We boast a total 25 individually decorated guest rooms, each with their own private bathroom and many with private outside entrances that only you would use. 

Every one of our lovely rooms have views of the Monterey Bay and the beautiful Monterey Peninsula coastline. 

Each room has a Keurig beverage maker.

We gladly anticipate the wishes of our guests and endeavor to make your visit to Seven Gables Inn one that you will always remember. 

—Your hosts, The Kirkwood Collection and Staff 

Note: This information was updated on August 13th 2021

*Since this is a hotel, we require a credit card on file for
neighborhood_overview: Pacific Grove is a very quiet seaside town with excellent restaurants within walking distance from Seven Gables, a biking and hiking trail running for miles along the oceanfront and spectacular natural scenery.  Pacific Grove and Monterey are right next to each other.  Carmel is just a short 5 mile drive away.
host_about:
As of June 23rd 2021, The Seven Gables Inn is managed by the Kirkwood Collection. 

Our Inn welcomed its first guests in 1982 and since then, we have enjoyed every aspect of Innkeeping. 

For all reservation questions please feel free to send us a message as we will respond as soon as possible. 

We boast a total 25 individually decorated guest rooms, each with their own private bathroom and many with private outside entrances that only you would use. 

Every one of our lovely rooms have views of the Monterey Bay and the beautiful Monterey Peninsula coastline. 

Each room has a Keurig beverage maker.

We gladly anticipate the wishes of our guests and endeavor to make your visit to Seven Gables Inn one that you will always remember. 

—Your hosts, The Kirkwood Collection and Staff 

Note: This information was updated on August 13th 2021

name: Charming Villa in Pacific Grove (sleeps 6)
description:
Last minute availability at a great price! Pacific Grove sits on the beautiful California coast between Monterey and Carmel and the unit is a 10 minute walk to the ocean edge. This is a spacious 1 bedroom quiet and private Villa with Queen-size Murphy bed (wall pull-out) and new Lazy Boy Queen sofa-sleeper in living room plus separate bedroom with king and 1 1/4 baths. Full kitchen, wood burning fireplace, plus shared hot tub and barbecue area. 2 large screen TVs. Great for family and friends!

The space
Charming Villa in very private and quiet end-unit in a 14-unit timeshare community. Available for one full week only. Private access to shared outdoor jacuzzi and deck with outdoor seating. Unit was built in the 1940s and is beautifully maintained to retain it's authentic architecture with exposed brick walls, solid wood dutch door, beautiful open beamed ceilings, wood burning fireplace and french doors. name: Pebble Beach Retreat
description:
We offer a private room and private bath in a family home in Pebble Beach. Keypad entry check-in. The hosts are fully vaccinated and boosted, and live on premise. We have a friendly indoor cat, so if you are allergic to cats, this is probably not a good fit for you. If you are a cat lover, you will find a friendly feline. Please be aware that we have two guest rooms, so there may be other guests in the house.

The space
Amenities: Comfortable queen bed, recently remodeled private bathroom, wireless internet. We offer self-serve breakfast: coffee, tea, and of course, organic super fresh farm eggs (from backyard hens). You will have access to the common areas of the house, including the gourmet kitchen. We just ask that you clean up after yourself if you use the common areas. Also, we ask that you wear a mask while using the common areas if you are unvaccinated. Off-street parking.

Guest access
We are located in the cloud forest above Montere

There are nearby hiking trails. The neighborhood is quiet with forest views.

neighborhood_overview:
We welcome you to experience the romance of the historic Pacific Grove Inn

The Pacific Grove Inn is a Historic Boutique Inn, that provides charming accommodations with the intimacy of a bed and breakfast. Built-in 1904 and 1908 by Sea Captain Frank LaVerne Buck and Apothecary Joseph Tuttle, these two establishments were remarkably sophisticated for their time and place in Pacific Grove on the Monterey Peninsula and are listed on the National Register of Historic Places.

With only 16 hotel rooms and suites, Pacific Grove Inn blends an old world charm with modern day luxury including combinations of fireplaces, private porches, balconies, and entrance with views of the Monterey Bay.

A sanctuary of tranquility and charm awaken your senses with a continental breakfast, unwind in the evening with your fellow guests in the parlor.

name: Getaway at Lovers Point
description:
This listing is the same house as Stay Awhile at Lovers Point. We remodeled the kitchen and replaced most of the wood floors.

The space
Very charming and artistic little house located near one of California's most beautiful locations in historic Pacific Grove. This house was photographed for Carmel Magazine in Feb.09 for its Pacific Grove edition. an easy walk to many restaurants, coffee shops, antique shops,movie theater, farmers market, natural history museum, golf and the beach. Two blocks from Lover's Point Park, Caledonia park, beach and the coastal recreation trail where you can bike or rent surreys, kayaks and paddleboards. This small Cottage has One bedroom with French antique bed, down comforter, crystal chandelier and mirrored dresser ,updated kitchen and a sunny coffee spot or reading nook. House has hardwood flooring. Comfy couches and dining room with extendable table. Tile shower/tub.Private backyard deck and seating area. Cable tv, Wi Fi, and DVD
neighborhood_overview: Ocean, rec trail, restaurants, shopping, museum, parks.
host_about:
I love living near the ocean here in Pacific Grove and walk daily with my dogs on the beach.I am a hair stylist and own a salon in Carmel, I own and renovate old houses and love to travel to tropical places. I enjoy walking to great restaurants and the  Farmer's market all within two blocks. This is the perfect location!
I hope your wanderings lead you to places you love.

name: Large french chateau in  Pebble Beach
description:
This is a large, French-style chateau which is only a few blocks from the famous Spanish Bay Resort, 2-minutes drive to the beach and only a few miles from the heart of downtown Pacific Grove. The kitchen has ample cabinet and drawer space which is fully stocked with dishes, flatware, glassware, kitchen linens, professional cookware and all necessary utensils. The home has brand new furnishings providing for a memorable and relaxing atmosphere. This is a quiet residential neighborhood.

The space
This secluded Coastal Estate sits on almost 1 acre of property surrounded by the Del Monte Forest and backs to natural open space green belt. This tranquil estate includes 5 bedrooms, 4. bathrooms, and 4,600 square feet of luxury living space.
Wonderful for families, close friends, or golf groups. Lots of privacy inside and out.

This large estate also has a 2-room apt with kitchenette and full bath that is above the garage which can be rented on an as
neighborhood_overview:
Wonderful, quiet neighborhood. House is in a very private setting, with ample parking. Surrounded by green zones with an occasional family of deer in the yard. Due to extreme fire potential in California these days, we cannot allow BBQs. We have a solo renter (single mature lady) of the apt in a separate building on the far side of the garage. She keeps to herself, you won't even know she is there.
Due to the residential nature of the property, we cannot allow weddings, parties, receptions, or the like. Thanks for respecting these rules.

name: Walking Distance to Beach and Monterey Bay
description:
Welcome to Pacific Gem in Pacific Grove

Conveniently located on Seventeen Mile Drive, Pacific Gem offers guests a two tenth of a mile walk to the beach, Esplanade Park and the Monterey Bay.

From the beach or Esplanade Park, guests may enjoy stunning views of the Pacific Ocean. On clear days, the Santa Cruz mountains beckon from across the vast Monterey Bay. Guest may enjoy watching the sea as yachts, sailboats, fishing boats and whale watching cruises pass by offshore. We have also seen whales breaching and spouting just offshore with the naked eye. And did we mention the spectacular Pacific Sunsets?

Our Pacific Gem is also located conveniently nearby the Pacific Grove Municipal Golf Course, also referred to as “The Public's Pebble Beach”. Your family’s golfer(‘s) can enjoy playing along the north shore of the Monterey Peninsula, or book a round at any of Pebble Beach’s five world class courses on the south and west shores.
neighborhood_overview:
Coast Estate invites you to experience the beautiful Monterey Peninsula and California Central Coast. The are is world renown for spectacular coastlines, unique coastal communities, and rich marine life. Coast Estate specializes in Luxury Vacation Rentals in Big Sur, Carmel, Carmel Highlands, Carmel Valley, Pacific Grove, Pebble Beach, Monterey and Seaside.

Local residents and visitors alike refer to Pacific Grove as “America’s last Hometown” and the “Butterfly Capital of California”, due to the annual migration of the Monarch butterflies. Pacific Grove is known for well kept Victorian homes and amazing seascapes along the scenic Sunset Drive.

Asilomar State Beach offers visitors beach and coast trail walks and a short, accessible boardwalk loop through the Asilomar Dunes Natural Preserve. The Point Pinos Lighthouse is the oldest continuously operating lighthouse on the West Coast and may be toured in the afternoon.

host_about:
Our CEO, MaryJane was an executive with the Hyatt for seven years. She chose to leave the work force and stayed home to raise three boys! MaryJane fell into a job I loved, managing a Vacation Rental Company on the Monterey Peninsula and fell in LOVE with the idea of renting homes instead of Hotels. She left the company and started her own business to continue her passion for meeting people near and far and sharing the love of travel.

AirBnb had software problems, and had to recreate several of our listings,  under a second account.

You may see MaryJane's 149 Guest Reviews from the original Host Account.

name: Monterey Plaza Hotel & Spa, Family Suite
description:
Perched dramatically on historic beachfront property above the crashing surf of the Pacific, Monterey Plaza Hotel & Spa delights its guests with classic, California coastal experiences animated by an irresistible spirit of conviviality and play.

Your room charge will be paid prior to your arrival. A $32 resort fee will be charged upon arrival. A refundable security deposit of $100 per night will also be collected.

The space
Spacious 800 sf suite offer two separate bedrooms, each with its own sliding glass doors out to a private balcony. Coastal décor throughout hotel, with spa-inspired marble bathrooms and a restful living area with gas fireplace. The sprawling property offers hangout spaces galore, from the refurbished lobby and Schooners Coastal Kitchen and Bar and the Vista Blue Spa.

Your room will include:
WiFi
Flat-screen TV
Pillowtop mattresses
Microfiber spa robes
Spa-inspired marble bathrooms
Zests bath

neighborhood_overview: NA
host_about:
Sanctuary Vacation Rentals represents properties throughout Carmel, Pebble Beach, Pacific Grove, Carmel Highlands, and the Big Sur coastline. We combine fine resort accommodations and relaxed elegance with all the comforts of home. 
Our properties are places that nurture and inspire and are located in one of the most beautiful, energizing places in the world, featuring the spectacular scenery of the Monterey Peninsula and the central coast of California.  From historic old Monterey, to the Victorian charm of Pacific Grove, and the artists colony of Carmel-by-the-Sea, and the breathtaking scenery of Big Sur, generations of people have been rejuvenated by the breaking waves and sandy beaches here.
Our properties are designer furnished with relaxed elegance.  Many homes feature the colors of the sea and take inspiration from the natural beauty of the surrounding areas.
Throughout Sanctuary’s vacation rentals, you’ll find comfortable beds with luxury linens, welcome beverages and hors d’oeuvres, spa robes and amenities, local wine tasting and spa passes, and a personal concierge to assist you in every way.  Our homes feature chef’s dream kitchens and everything you’ll need to entertain in style.  And many of our properties are pet friendly.
If you’re looking for a refreshing, relaxed stay in one of the most beautiful areas in the world– offering all the comforts of home, let Sanctuary Vacation Rentals help you discover your own sanctuary by the sea.  

The Monterey Peninsula is unique in its combination of breathtaking natural resources and a multiplicity of cultural and entertainment possibilities. You can find something for every possible taste. For nature lovers, there is the diversity of mountain and sea, for picnicking, surfing, fishing, horseback riding, hiking, beach-combing, bird-watching, kayaking, scuba diving, tide-pooling, biking and more. If you want a man-made excitement, we have art galleries galore, excellent fine-art museums, local theatre, outstanding restaurants, boutiques, a natural history and a children's museum, a world-class aquarium, and that's just for starters. History buffs will have a field day exploring the adobes of Monterey. There's so much to do that you cannot possibly do it all in one visit, which means you will have to come back.

name: Charming Monterey Bay Home near the Beach
description:
One and a half blocks to the water's edge. Lover's Point and the nearest sandy beach are about 2 blocks further. One block to Lighthouse Ave and downtown where you will find many restaurants. Monterey Bay Aquarium is walkable, about 18 minutes on foot, 20 minutes by car. Pebble Beach, Carmel by the Sea, Monterey Fisherman's Wharf, Cannery Row are nearby, Big Sur is 50 minutes away. Decor is beachy, nautical theme. Safeway supermarket and Trader Joe's are about 8 minutes away by car.

Guest access
Guests may use the entire home and grounds except for the garage.

Other things to note
The 2nd floor has a balcony with a very limited view of the bay.
neighborhood_overview: One and half blocks to the oceanside. Lover's Point and the beach are about 4 blocks away, one block to Lighthouse Avenue, restaurants and downtown area, a movie theater is two blocks away, Monterey Bay Aquarium and Cannery Row are a 20 minute walk away. Fisherman's Wharf is a 10 minute drive. Big Sur is roughly a 50  minute drive. Many restaurants to choose from. Safeway supermarket is 8 minutes away as is Trader Joe's.

name: La Piccola Casa "The Little House"   Lic. # 0446
description:
Every house has a story but few are as iconic as La Piccola Casa. Built in early 1900, La Piccola has had a diverse journey. This lovely Victorian lady spent her early years as a Pacific Grove residence before becoming La Piccola Pizzeria & Coffee Shop in 2005. After years of serving thousands of guests, La Piccola has taken on a new life. Lovingly restored by restaurateurs, Joe & Laurie Rombi, she has returned to her roots as a residence while still retaining memories of her culinary past.

The space
La Piccola is an authentic Victorian with all of the modern conveniences and amenities any savvy traveler could want. This two bedroom, two bath cottage has pillow top queen beds, crisp white linens and fluffy bath towels along with individual toiletries. La Piccola comes complete with brand new washer/dryer, utility sink, hair dryers, USB plugs by every nightstand, reverse osmosis drinking water tap, cable television with 60" plasma TV, high speed WiFi and S
neighborhood_overview:
Just a few short blocks to the ocean, La Piccola is located on one of the most convenient streets in Pacific Grove. She's surrounded by restaurants, coffee shops, a juicery, bakeries, a movie theatre, grocery store and shopping. To name just a few of the amazing eateries on the very same block of 17th Street are La Mia Cucina (best Italian on the Peninsula!), Takara (Sushi) and Fandango (Continental Cuisine). With Grove Market just a stone's throw across the parking lot, all your grocery needs are met without ever getting in the car!

Parking passes will be provided for the lot directly across the street. Please be sure to read the FINE PRINT in the Policies / House Rules Section for more details.

description:
A walker’s paradise minutes to beautiful Lovers Point Beach & Family Park. Walk to town with great cafes, fine dining, shopping & movie theater. Easy stroll to spectacular ocean and bike trail, Monterey Bay Aquarium and famed Cannery Row. Ideal space for couples or families with children. The perfect monthly vacation rental or beach retreat. This lovely home has been recently renovated. All the furniture is high-end combining style with comfort. Children & 2 adult Aquarium passes provided.

The space
This beautiful residence has 3 bedrooms, 2 baths. The bedrooms are tastefully furnished with high quality beds, linens, down comforters, ceiling fans for cool air circulation and HDTVs. Bathrooms have luxury bath towels, wash cloths, blow dryer, curling iron, soap, shampoo + conditioner. The master bedroom features a king size bed with access to an outdoor patio area complete with comfy chairs to enjoy your morning coffee with an ocean view. The downstairs bathroo
neighborhood_overview:
Pacific Grove is a popular destination and much appreciated for its cool coastal summer weather & spectacular scenic beauty. This magnificent location continues to entice travelers from around the world for famous attractions such as:

The AT&T Golf Pro-Am
Pebble Beach Concours d'Elegance
Monterey Jazz Festival
Laguna Seca Sports Car Championship
Pebble Beach Food and Wine Festival
Pacific Grove Feast of Lanterns
Monterey Fisherman’s Wharf
Monterey Bay Aquarium
Big Sur National Park, plus so much more.

The home is located in a quiet neighborhood, a ten minute drive to Pebble Beach, Spanish Bay or any of the famous golf courses within the gates of 17-Mile Drive. Monterey and Carmel are also just a quick car ride from the home’s location.

name: 4 Bedroom home with Ocean Views on the Fairway
description:
Coral Treasure is a custom four (4) bedroom ranch style house on the golf course and a 5 minute walk to the Beach!!

This home is located on the 17th hole of The Dunes Private Golf Course.

Upon entering the front door, the first thing you see is the living room with the gorgeous ocean view and golf greens. (This golf course is private, see Media tab for a link to public golf courses within just a few miles of this house) You walk towards the large sliding glass doors and as you open them you are greeted with the scent of fresh ocean air! All around the home is a wonderland of blooming flowers and lush plants. Each room as a Cal King bed and its own TV.

The living room is large and it accommodates 10 or more for seating. There is a fireplace, game table and a 60 inch TV. There are several games such as poker, dominoes, board games and much more.
-
Next to the living room is the formal dining room. The table seats 8 to 12 comforta
neighborhood_overview:
Coast Estate invites you to experience the beautiful Monterey Peninsula and California Central Coast. The are is world renown for spectacular coastlines, unique coastal communities, and rich marine life. Coast Estate specializes in Luxury Vacation Rentals in Big Sur, Carmel, Carmel Highlands, Carmel Valley, Pacific Grove, Pebble Beach, Monterey and Seaside.

Pebble Beach is more than any Golfer could ever dream of, with eight Championship golf courses. Locals and visitors alike flock to 17 Mile Drive, one of the best-known and most spectacular scenic drives in the world. Cypress Point Club, Monterey Peninsula Dunes Golf Course, Pebble Beach Golf Links, Poppy Hills, Spyglass Hill Golf Course and The Links at Spanish Bay are all within 10 to 15 minutes driving distance from any point in the Del Monte Forest.

There are also miles of hiking, bicycling and equestrian trails that wind through the scenic Del Monte Forest. Fine dining is available at The Lodge at P
host_about:
Our CEO, MaryJane was an executive with the Hyatt for seven years. She chose to leave the work force and stayed home to raise three boys! MaryJane fell into a job I loved, managing a Vacation Rental Company on the Monterey Peninsula and fell in LOVE with the idea of renting homes instead of Hotels. She left the company and started her own business to continue her passion for meeting people near and far and sharing the love of travel.

AirBnb had software problems, and had to recreate several of our listings,  under a second account.

You may see MaryJane's 149 Guest Reviews from the original Host Account.

neighborhood_overview: NA
host_about:
Sanctuary Vacation Rentals represents properties throughout Carmel, Pebble Beach, Pacific Grove, Carmel Highlands, and the Big Sur coastline. We combine fine resort accommodations and relaxed elegance with all the comforts of home. 
Our properties are places that nurture and inspire and are located in one of the most beautiful, energizing places in the world, featuring the spectacular scenery of the Monterey Peninsula and the central coast of California.  From historic old Monterey, to the Victorian charm of Pacific Grove, and the artists colony of Carmel-by-the-Sea, and the breathtaking scenery of Big Sur, generations of people have been rejuvenated by the breaking waves and sandy beaches here.
Our properties are designer furnished with relaxed elegance.  Many homes feature the colors of the sea and take inspiration from the natural beauty of the surrounding areas.
Throughout Sanctuary’s vacation rentals, you’ll find comfortable beds with luxury linens, welcome beverages and hors d’oeuvres, spa robes and amenities, local wine tasting and spa passes, and a personal concierge to assist you in every way.  Our homes feature chef’s dream kitchens and everything you’ll need to entertain in style.  And many of our properties are pet friendly.
If you’re looking for a refreshing, relaxed stay in one of the most beautiful areas in the world– offering all the comforts of home, let Sanctuary Vacation Rentals help you discover your own sanctuary by the sea.  

The Monterey Peninsula is unique in its combination of breathtaking natural resources and a multiplicity of cultural and entertainment possibilities. You can find something for every possible taste. For nature lovers, there is the diversity of mountain and sea, for picnicking, surfing, fishing, horseback riding, hiking, beach-combing, bird-watching, kayaking, scuba diving, tide-pooling, biking and more. If you want a man-made excitement, we have art galleries galore, excellent fine-art museums, local theatre, outstanding restaurants, boutiques, a natural history and a children's museum, a world-class aquarium, and that's just for starters. History buffs will have a field day exploring the adobes of Monterey. There's so much to do that you cannot possibly do it all in one visit, which means you will have to come back.

name: Historic Victorian Cottage Steps to Ocean!
description:
Please reach out for up to the minute availability or with any questions !

One of the closest homes to the white sand beaches at Lovers Point & blocks from downtown Pacific Grove. The Aquarium is less than a mile down the trail. This cottage, built in 1892, exudes charm with original redwood floors, stained glass and ornate carved detail. A light, airy beach house, modernized for a relaxing getaway!

The space
*Breathtaking views of Monterey Bay
*External security cameras
*Steps from the Ocean
*Steps from the coastal trail
*Bike, kayak, surrey rental at the end of our street
*Ocean views from 3 bedrooms
*Gas Grill on the back patio off the kitchen
*Pack and Play and high chair available
*All bedrooms are on the second story
*Outdoor shower
*Very strict no pet policy

There is no driveway or garage at this property; parking is available on the street. Guests are encouraged to bring a maximum o
neighborhood_overview:
Lover's Point Beach is steps away for playing and picnicing, renting bikes, kayaks and paddling with the harbor seals and sea otters.

Pacific Grove has dozens of great restaurants, coffee shops, and wine bars— within a short walk of the house. The recreation trail on the coast is just a few steps away and will take you to all of the sites. Pacific Grove is a great walking and biking town.

Downtown:

* Captain + Stoker and Bookworks for coffee

*‘Peppers’ Mexican, our favorite spot, is 2 blocks up our street and is awesome! Pacific Thai on Lighthouse is another one we love. Wild Fish, also on Lighthouse, has wonderful fresh seafood with live music on the weekends!

*Michaels has the best Mexican take out, IL Vecchio on Central Ave is hands down the best Italian Restaurant in town (dine outside or takeout- generous portions and GREAT Cannoli!), Zum Sushi on Central is awesome for takeout as well.

*Asilomar beach for bo
host_about: Hi! We're Anne and Gary Gaddini.  We have lived in Redwood City long enough to raise and launch 4 out of our 5 daughters! :)  We love the two Northern California gems of the SF Bay Area and Pacific Grove! We have also very much loved being Airbnb hosts!  Please reach out with any questions.  We hope to host you soon!

lighthouse (Downtown)- 4 blocks
beach & Lover's Point- 8 blocks
aquarium- 1m
Short drive to Pebble Beach, Carmel, 17-Mile drive & Monterey
Pacific Grove Inn blends an old world charm with modern day luxury.

The space
Beautiful old Victorian cottage. Four individual bedrooms, Four individual bathrooms. There are two rooms on the first floor with a full kitchen & living room area, another two rooms in the basement area. The house is so close to cafes/restaurants and the Library along with the Natural History Museum, you may never use your car once here.

The Duplex house is part of the Buck building (Front Building).
Above Duplex house there are Units rented to others guests.
The DUPLEX Ho
neighborhood_overview:
We welcome you to experience the romance of the historic Pacific Grove Inn

The Pacific Grove Inn is a Historic Boutique Inn, that provides charming accommodations with the intimacy of a bed and breakfast. Built-in 1904 and 1908 by Sea Captain Frank LaVerne Buck and Apothecary Joseph Tuttle, these two establishments were remarkably sophisticated for their time and place in Pacific Grove on the Monterey Peninsula and are listed on the National Register of Historic Places.

With only 16 hotel rooms and suites, Pacific Grove Inn blends an old world charm with modern day luxury including combinations of fireplaces, private porches, balconies, and entrance with views of the Monterey Bay.

A sanctuary of tranquility and charm awaken your senses with a continental breakfast, unwind in the evening with your fellow guests in the parlor.


Local residents and visitors alike refer to Pacific Grove as “America’s last Hometown” and the “Butterfly Capi

description:
500 sf, 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom vacation home sleeps up to 2 guests. 1 Queen. No pets. No garage.

Welcome to “Mermaid Loft”! Sleeps 2

A romantic hideaway made just for two awaits you in the Lovers Point area of Pacific Grove, just steps from the beach and the Monterey Bay Recreation Trail, and within easy walking distance of downtown dining and shopping. Watch twinkling lights on the bay in the evening from this upper story loft, or during the day, view waves, whales and fishing boats on ...

The space
...the water.

This 1-bedroom, 1-bath home is a perfect place to enjoy the best of the Monterey Peninsula, since it’s conveniently located near some of the region’s prime attractions, including the Monterey Bay Aquarium, the Monarch Sanctuary, and Asilomar. Newly restored historic home with spacious rooms, modern amenities and large garden. Ideal downtown location on quiet street within blocks of the ocean. It’s coastal living at its finest!

The space
Enjoy our newly renovated home with original hardwood floors and moldings, stained glass windows, and tall ceilings.

Guest access
House is on a quiet street right off Lighthouse Ave, the main street running through downtown Pacific Grove. Parking is generally always available in front of the house.

Other things to note
Home is on a double lot elevated from street. Its large garden can be seen from several vantage poin

name: Private Stand-alone Cottages near Ocean & Beach
description:
A stroll, a kiss, a feeling, a sound, a sunset shared.

Retreat to the Pacific coast and experience a breath of fresh ocean air at this quaint Victorian boutique Inn. Centrella Inn has been a peaceful, romantic retreat destination of choice for charm and romance since 1889.

Ideally located: 2 minute walk to Lover’s Point & beach. 15 minutes walk to world-famous Monterey Bay Aquarium and historic Cannery Row. Close to Pebble Beach, Carmel and Big Sur.

Select Cottages are Pet friendly.

The space
These are individual cottages around a Victorian garden with a Master bedroom and a separate living room.

They have fireplaces, wet bar, mini fridge, clawfoot tub bath, TV, dining table and a sofa-bed.

The Cottages can accomodate families with children. The Cottages are ideal choice for guests seeking privacy in a cozy and intimate setting for a quiet retreat.

Rates are based on double occupancy. $40 per
neighborhood_overview:
Ideal location in a peaceful & charming neighborhood.

- 1 block from Pacific Grove downtown with many romantic restaurant, wine tasting rooms, cafes and boutique shops.

- 2 minute walk to Lover's Point Beach (one of the most popular beaches on the Monterey Peninsula) and coastal recreational trails.

- 10 minutes walk along the coastal recreational trail to the world-renowned Monterey Bay Aquarium and Cannery Row.

- 5 minutes drive to Pebble Beach & 17-Mile Drive.

- Short drive to Carmel by the Sea and world famous Highway 1 to Big Sur.
